Title: January 2021
Content: *p67820a0916*turn over    9(f) in method 2, 50.0 cm3 of potassium chlorate(v) was mixed with 150 cm3 of  0.0750 mol dm3 of iron(ii) sulfate. the iron (ii) sulfate was in excess.the whole of this solution required 9.25 cm3 of 0.050 mol dm3 of  potassium manganate(vii) to completely react.the equations for the reactions areclo3(aq) + 6fe2+(aq) + 6h+(aq)  cl(aq) + 6fe3+(aq) + 3h2o(l)mno4(aq) + 5fe2+(aq) + 8h+(aq)  mn2+(aq) + 5fe3+(aq) + 4h2o(l)calculate the concentration, in mol dm3, of the potassium chlorate(v) solution. you must show your working.(6)
